body: txt for picking that up. However, I think it is very user-specific. Maybe it is better to define the character list in config.json to be more flexible but as you increase the list, your model is also getting larger quite considerably. Therefore it is not a good idea to provide a huge har list due to practical reasons

I'd agree suggestion by @erogol . Your additions might be good for portuguese but eg. german special chars would be missing (äüöß).
Adding specific chars for all global languages would end in a really long string of possible characters.

@erogol  I agree with you !
I believe that replacing capital letters with missing letters is good enough for Transfer Learning, I tested it in Brazilian Portuguese and got good results.

To train a new model in another language and after adding it to this repository, do you suggest a fork and within that fork create a new branch with the necessary modifications?

I ask why we intend to provide a multi-speaker model for Brazilian Portuguese.

I think we can override the default charset if something is given in config.json. That would be a nice PR if it sounds good for you. Then, we don't really fork for every language but give the config file.

@erogol  Do you recommend adding all Text parameters (characters, punctuation) and Phoneme parameters (_vowels, _non_pulmonic_consonants, _pulmonic_consonants, _suprasegmentals, _other_symbols, _diacrilics) to config.json?
I think if you give a list in config.json it should overwrite everything in symbols. So TTS should only use the list you give.
@erogol  I submitted a pull request with the suggestion discussed here. I ran all the tests and everything seems to work fine.

@erogol  I submitted a pull request with the suggestions discussed here for the dev branch as well.

I noticed a problem in the "dev" branch, the scripts are not saving all phonemes in phoneme_cache_path, so the execution is interrupted (this only happens in the "dev" branch, in the master branch everything works fine). The problem was already present before my commit.
@Edresson can you post the error message?

I've already created a new env and installed the requirements of the dev branch, but that didn't solve the problem.
thats ```phonemizer``` bug. If you install it from the latest master branch it should work.
@erogol  Thank you very much, everything is working fine now :)
